page.title: 07Leckford Village
page.content: The village,about{two miles to the {north west of Stockbridge}has approximately forty houses and cottages,mainly built of brick,some of them being rendered white.Most of the houses have slate roofs although there are some thatched ones.{All the houses {are occupied by present or retired {employees of the John Lewis {Partnership},and are all painted in {the }partnership colours of green and white. In the centre of the village is a {shop}which is also a{post office and {off licence.}The shop sells groceries,hardware,sweets and icecreams. There is a church( see page 9,) an old chapel,used for storage,a club (page 8) and a recreation ground.The {old railway}runs alongside the main road from Andover to Stockbridge.
